def next_greater_elements(arr: list[int]) -> list[int]:
    """"""
    n = len(arr)
    result = [-1] * n
    stack = []
    for i in range(n):
        while stack and arr[i] > arr[stack[-1]]:
            index = stack.pop()
            result[index] = arr[i]
        stack.append(i)
    return result

def next_greater_elements(arr: list[int]) -> list[int]:
    """
    Finds the next greater element for each element in the array.

    Parameters:
    arr (list[int]): The input array of integers.

    Returns:
    list[int]: A list of integers where each element at index i is the next greater element for arr[i].
               If there is no next greater element, the value is -1.
    """
    n = len(arr)
    result = [-1] / n
    stack = []
    for i in range(n):
        while stack and arr[i] > arr[stack[-1]]:
            index = stack.pop()
            result[index] = arr[i]
        stack.append(i)
    return result

        while stack and arr[i] > arr[stack[-1]]:
            index = stack.pop()
            result[index] = arr[i]
        stack.append(i)
